Label: Accusations leveled against Agrappina
Significance: A group of people leveled accusations against Agrappina, trying to turn Nero against her and bring her down.

Label: Acte
Significance: Freedwoman that Nero had an affair with.

Label: Aedui
Significance: One of the prominent Gallic Tribes

Label: Aemilius Mamercus
Significance: One of two Quaestors elected sixty-three years after founding of the Republic

Label: Afranius Burrus
Significance: Advised Nero during his youth on military and moral matters. Disagreed with Agrippina on the succession of Claudius.

Label: Agrippina
Significance: Nero’s mother and Claudius’ last wife

Label: Annaeus Seneca
Significance: Adviser to Nero in his youth with his oratorical and cordiality skills

Label: Byzantium
Significance: City founded by Greeks with fertile soil and prosperous seas

Label: Cincian Law
Significance: Forbade the acceptance of money or a gift for pleading a case

Label: Cleopatra
Significance: Was with Claudius when Calpurnia notified of the marriage between Messalina and Silius

Label: Crepereius Gallus
Significance: Male slave to Agrippina; killed during Nero’s assassination attempt.

Label: Domitius Corbulo
Significance: Responsible for the military campaign in Armenia.

Label: Egyptian Equestrians
Significance: Claudius surrendered the legal system to them

Label: Euodus
Significance: In charge of overseeing Messalina’s death.

Label: Gaius Silius
Significance: best-looking of rome’s young men, Messalina liked him. Having affair with Messalina.

Label: Garden of Lucullus
Significance: Where Messalina goes to hide from her executors.

Label: Gnaeus Nonius
Significance: Knight; possibly tried to assassinate the Emperor

Label: Halotus
Significance: Taster for imperial dinners. But is aware of the intended poisoning of Cladius.

Label: Junia Silana
Significance: Girlfriend of Agrippina. Noblewoman of Rome. Formerly married to Gaius Silius.

Label: Junius Silanus
Significance: Proconsul of Asia. Killed by Agrippina. Was preferred over Nero.

Label: King Vologaeses
Significance: He chose peace over war, supported Rome by supplying them hostages, and put the leading members of the Arsacid house in the Roman’s hands. King of Parthia.

Label: Lepida
Significance: Wife of Claudius, daughter of Antonia, and rival to Agrippina

Label: Locusta
Significance: Made the poison that killed Claudius

Label: Lollia Paulina
Significance: Wife candidate for Claudius after the murder of Messalina. She had no children so she was the most ideal candidate.

Label: Lucius Silanus
Significance: Brother of Junius Silanus. A praetor.

Label: Messalina
Significance: in the midst of adulterous affair. Third wife of Claudius.

Label: Mnester
Significance: Actor that Messalina had affections for.

Label: Nero
Significance: Senators support Nero’s effort to disallow the pleading of a case for payment or gifts & that Quaestors-designate would not be obliged to give gladatorial shows

Label: New Patrician Families
Significance: Claudius admitted more affluent families into the ranks of the Patricians

Label: Octavia
Significance: Daughter of Claudius, married Nero in the consulship of Decimus Junius and Quintus Haterus. Also sister to Britannicus and step-sister to Nero.

Label: Ostia
Significance: Cladius was on a prolonged stay in…

Label: Pallas
Significance: Nero revoked the responsibilities given to Pallas by Claudius.

Label: People of Cos
Significance: Group for which Claudius advocated tax exemption.

Label: Poison
Significance: Used as a weapon to kill many

Label: Political Murder
Significance: Ways that a political actor may usurp power.

Label: Pomerium
Significance: Expanded under the rule of Claudius

Label: Quaestor
Significance: Elected position, who’s function is to supervise military finance

Label: Secular Games
Significance: First put on by Augustus, now Claudius.

Label: Sinuessa
Significance: Narcissus went there when he fell ill to stress.

Label: Statilius Taurus
Significance: “Destroyed” by Agrippina because she coveted his gardens, accused by Tarquitius Priscus, wealthy, proconsul in Africa.

Label: Suicide
Significance: We feel this speaks for itself

Label: Tarquitius Priscus
Significance: Accuser and legate of Statilius Taurus

Label: The Gallic Tribes
Significance: A Celtic Group of Peoples who lived in Gaul (modern-day France)

Label: The Greek People
Significance: They were people and they were Greek

Label: The Roman Officers
Significance: Their favor caused friction between generals. Left to decide which General they supported more.

Label: The Roman People
Significance: The population of Rome (shocking, I know)

Label: The Senate
Significance: Advising body. AD 53: Received an appeal from the people of Byzantium to releive their heavy tax burden.

Label: Titius Proculus
Significance: Guardian for Messalina appointed by Silius. Claudius eventually ordered him to be executed.

Label: Ubii
Significance: The main town of a tribe where Agrippina was born, and Agrippa had taken the area under roman protection

Label: Valerius Potitus
Significance: One of two Quaestors first elected

Label: senate awards funds
Significance: money is awarded by the senate to those who advised claudius
